AllowLocalNetworkLoopback.description: Flag indicating whether to allow local network loopback.

AppDesignerFolder.description: Name of folder for Application Designer

AppxAutoIncrementPackageRevision.description: Flag indicating whether to auto-increment package revision.

AppxBundle.description: Flag indicating whether packaging targets will produce an app bundle.

AppxBundleAutoResourcePackageQualifiers.description: '|'-delimited list of resource qualifiers which will be used for automatic resource pack splitting.

AppxBundleDir.description: Full path to a folder where app bundle will be produced.

AppxBundleFolderSuffix.description: Suffix to append to app bundle folder.

AppxBundleMainPackageFileMapGeneratedFil.description: Full path to a log file containing a list of generated files during generation of main package file map.

AppxBundleMainPackageFileMapIntermediate.description: Full path to an intermediate main package file map.
Prefix used for intermediate main package resources .pri and .map.txt files.
Full path to an intermediate main package .pri file.

AppxBundleMainPackageFileMapPath.description: Full path to a main package file map.

AppxBundleMainPackageFileMapPrefix.description: Prefix used for main package resources .pri and .map.txt files.

AppxBundleMainPackageFileMapSuffix.description: Suffix used before extension of resource map files.

AppxBundlePlatforms.description: '|'-delimited list of platforms which will be included in an app bundle.

AppxBundlePriConfigXmlForMainPackageFile.description: Full path to the priconfig.xml file used for generating main package file map.

AppxBundlePriConfigXmlForSplittingFileNa.description: Full path to the priconfig.xml file used for splitting resource packs.

AppxBundleProducingPlatform.description: A platform which will be used to produce an app bundle.

AppxBundleResourcePacksProducingPlatform.description: A platform which will be used to produce resource packs for an app bundle.

AppxBundleSplitResourcesGeneratedFilesLi.description: Full path to a log file containing a list of generated files during resource splitting.

AppxBundleSplitResourcesPriPath.description: Full path to split resources .pri file.

AppxBundleSplitResourcesPriPrefix.description: Prefix used for split resources .pri and .map.txt files.

AppxBundleSplitResourcesQualifiersPath.description: Full path to a log file containing a detected qualifiers during resource splitting.

AppxCopyLocalFilesOutputGroupIncludeXmlF.description: Flag indicating whether CopyLocal files group should include XML files.

AppxCreatePriFilesForPortableLibrariesAd.description: Additional parameters to pass to makepri.exe when generating PRI file for a portable library.

AppxDefaultHashAlgorithmId.description: Default hash algorithm ID, used for signing an app package.

AppxDefaultResourceQualifiers.description: '|'-delimited list of key=value pairs representing default resource qualifiers.

AppxExpandPriContentAdditionalMakepriExe.description: Additional parameters to pass to makepri.exe when extracting payload file names.

AppxFilterOutUnusedLanguagesResourceFile.description: Flag indicating whether to filter out unused language resource file maps.

AppxGeneratePriEnabled.description: Flag indicating whether to generate resource index files (PRI files) during packaging.

AppxGenerateProjectPriFileAdditionalMake.description: Additional parameters to pass to makepri.exe when generating project PRI file.

AppxHarvestWinmdRegistration.description: Flag indicating whether to enable harvesting of WinMD registration information.

AppxLayoutDir.description: Full path to the folder where package layout will be prepared when producing an app bundle.

AppxLayoutFolderName.description: Name of the folder where package layout will be prepared when producing an app bundle.

AppxMSBuildTaskAssembly.description: Full path to packaging build tasks assembly.

AppxMSBuildToolsPath.description: Full path to a folder containing packaging build targets and tasks assembly.

AppxOSMaxVersionTestedReplaceManifestVer.description: Flag indicating whether maximum OS version tested in app manifest should be replaced.

AppxOSMinVersionReplaceManifestVersion.description: Flag indicating whether minimum OS version in app manifest should be replaced.

AppxPackage.description: Flag marking current project as capable of being packaged as an app package.

AppxPackageAllowDebugFrameworkReferences.description: Flag indicating whether to allow inclusion of debug framework references in an app manifest.

AppxPackageArtifactsDir.description: Additional qualifier to append to AppxPackageDir.

AppxPackageDir.description: Full path to a folder where app packages will be saved.

AppxPackageDirName.description: Name of the folder where app packages are produced.

AppxPackageFileMap.description: Full path to app package file map.

AppxPackageIncludePrivateSymbols.description: Flag indicating whether to include private symbols in symbol packages.

AppxPackageName.description: Name of the app package to generate.

AppxPackageOutput.description: Full path to the app package file.

AppxPackageRecipe.description: Full path to the app package recipe.

AppxPackageSigningEnabled.description: Flag indicating whether to enable signing of app packages.

AppxPackageTestDir.description: Name of the folder where test app packages will be copied

AppxPackageValidationEnabled.description: Flag indicating whether to enable validation of app packages.

AppxPackagingInfoFile.description: Full path to the packaging info file which will contain paths to produced packages.

AppxPrependPriInitialPath.description: Flag indicating whether to enable prepending initial path when indexing RESW and RESJSON files in class libraries.

AppxPriConfigXmlDefaultSnippetPath.description: Path to an XML file containing default element for priconfi.xml file.

AppxPriConfigXmlPackagingSnippetPath.description: Path to an XML file containing packaging element for priconfi.xml file.

AppxPriInitialPath.description: Initial path when indexing RESW and RESJSON files in class libraries.

AppxSkipUnchangedFiles.description: Flag indicating whether to skip unchanged files when copying files during creation of app packages.

AppxStoreContainer.description: Name of the app store container to generate.

AppxStrictManifestValidationEnabled.description: Flag indicating whether to enable strict manifest validation.

AppxSymbolPackageEnabled.description: Flag indicating whether to generate a symbol package when an app package is created.

AppxSymbolPackageOutput.description: Full path to the app symbol package file.

AppxSymbolStrippedDir.description: Full path to a directory where stripped PDBs will be stored.

AppxTestLayoutEnabled.description: Flag indicating whether to create test layout when an app package is created.

AppxUseHardlinksIfPossible.description: Flag indicating whether to use hard links if possible when copying files during creation of app packages.

AppxValidateAppxManifest.description: Flag indicating whether to validate app manifest.

AppxValidateStoreManifest.description: Flag indicating whether to validate store manifest.

AssemblyKeyContainerName.description: The name of the CAPI container that holds the strong-naming key used to sign the output assembly.

AssemblyKeyProviderName.description: The name of the CAPI provider that provides the strong-naming key used to sign the output assembly.

AssemblyOriginatorKeyFile.description: The path of the strong-naming key (.snk) file used to sign the output assembly.

AssemblyVersion.description: Numeric value of the version for the assembly manifest in the format major.minor.patch (e.g. 2.4.0)

Authors.description: A comma-separated list of NuGet packages authors

AutoGenerateBindingRedirects.description: Indicates whether BindingRedirect elements should be automatically generated for referenced assemblies.

AutoIncrementPackageRevision.description: Flag indicating whether to enable auto increment of an app package revision.

CodeAnalysisAdditionalOptions.description: Additional options to pass to the Code Analysis command line tool.

CodeAnalysisApplyLogFileXsl.description: Indicates whether to apply the XSL style sheet specified in $(CodeAnalysisLogFileXsl) to the Code Analysis report. This report is specified in $(CodeAnalysisLogFile). The default is false.

CodeAnalysisConsoleXsl.description: Path to the XSL style sheet that will be applied to the Code Analysis console output. The default is an empty string (''), which causes Code Analysis to use its default console output.

CodeAnalysisCulture.description: Culture to use for Code Analysis spelling rules, for example, 'en-US' or 'en-AU'. The default is the current user interface language for Windows.

CodeAnalysisFailOnMissingRules.description: Indicates whether Code Analysis should fail if a rule or rule set is missing. The default is false.

CodeAnalysisForceOutput.description: Indicates whether Code Analysis generates a report file, even when there are no active warnings or errors. The default is true.

CodeAnalysisGenerateSuccessFile.description: Indicates whether Code Analysis generates a '$(CodeAnalysisInputAssembly).lastcodeanalysissucceeded' file in the output folder when no build-breaking errors occur. The default is true.

CodeAnalysisIgnoreBuiltInRules.description: Indicates whether Code Analysis will ignore the default rule directories when searching for rules. The default is false.

CodeAnalysisIgnoreBuiltInRuleSets.description: Indicates whether Code Analysis will ignore the default rule set directories when searching for rule sets. The default is false.

CodeAnalysisIgnoreGeneratedCode.description: Indicates whether Code Analysis should fail silently when it analyzes invalid assemblies, such as those without managed code. The default is true.

CodeAnalysisIgnoreInvalidTargets.description: Indicates whether Code Analysis should silently fail when analyzing invalid assemblies, such as those without managed code. The default is true.

CodeAnalysisInputAssembly.description: Path to the assembly to be analyzed by Code Analysis. The default is '$(OutDir)$(TargetName)$(TargetExt)'.

CodeAnalysisLogFile.description: Path to the output file for the Code Analysis report. The default is '$(CodeAnalysisInputAssembly).CodeAnalysisLog.xml'.

CodeAnalysisLogFileXsl.description: Path to the XSL style sheet to reference in the Code Analysis output report. This report is specified in $(CodeAnalysisLogFile). The default is an empty string ('').

CodeAnalysisModuleSuppressionsFile.description: Name of the file, without the path, where Code Analysis project-level suppressions are stored. The default is 'GlobalSuppressions$(DefaultLanguageSourceExtension)'.

CodeAnalysisOutputToConsole.description: Indicates whether to output Code Analysis warnings and errors to the console. The default is false.

CodeAnalysisOverrideRuleVisibilities.description: Indicates whether to run all overridable Code Analysis rules against all targets. This will cause specific rules, such as those within the Design and Naming categories, to run against both public and internal APIs, instead of only public APIs. The default is false.

CodeAnalysisPath.description: Path to the Code Analysis installation folder. The default is '$(VSINSTALLDIR)\Team Tools\Static Analysis Tools\FxCop'.

CodeAnalysisPlatformPath.description: Path to the .NET Framework folder that contains platform assemblies, such as mscorlib.dll and System.dll. The default is an empty string ('').

CodeAnalysisProject.description: Path to the Code Analysis project (*.fxcop) to load. The default is an empty string ('').

CodeAnalysisQuiet.description: Indicates whether to suppress all Code Analysis console output other than errors and warnings. This applies when $(CodeAnalysisOutputToConsole) is true. The default is false.

CodeAnalysisRuleAssemblies.description: Semicolon-separated list of paths either to Code Analysis rule assemblies or to folders that contain Code Analysis rule assemblies. The paths are in the form '+|-]!]file|folder]', where '+' enables all rules in rule assembly, '-' disables all rules in rule assembly, and '!' causes all rules in rule assembly to be treated as errors. For example '+D:\Projects\Rules\NamingRules.dll;+!D:\Projects\Rules\SecurityRules.dll'. The default is '$(CodeAnalysisPath)\Rules'.

CodeAnalysisRuleDirectories.description: Semicolon-separated list of directories in which to search for rules when resolving a rule set. The default is '$(CodeAnalysisPath)\Rules' unless the CodeAnalysisIgnoreBuiltInRules property is set to true.

CodeAnalysisRules.description: Semicolon-separated list of Code Analysis rules. The rules are in the form '+|-]!]Category#CheckId', where '+' enables the rule, '-' disables the rule, and '!' causes the rule to be treated as an error. For example, '-Microsoft.Naming#CA1700;+!Microsoft.Naming#CA1701'. The default is an empty string ('') which enables all rules.

CodeAnalysisRuleSet.description: A .ruleset file which contains a list of rules to run during analysis. The string can be a full path, a path relative to the project file, or a file name. If a file name is specified, the CodeAnalysisRuleSetDirectories property will be searched to find the file. The default is an empty string ('').

CodeAnalysisRuleSetDirectories.description: Semicolon-separated list of directories in which to search for rule sets. The default is '$(VSINSTALLDIR)\Team Tools\Static Analysis Tools\Rule Sets' unless the CodeAnalysisIgnoreBuiltInRuleSets property is set to true.

CodeAnalysisSaveMessagesToReport.description: Comma-separated list of the type ('Active', 'Excluded', or 'Absent') of warnings and errors to save to the output report file. The default is 'Active'.

CodeAnalysisSearchGlobalAssemblyCache.description: Indicates whether Code Analysis should search the Global Assembly Cache (GAC) for missing references that are encountered during analysis. The default is true.

CodeAnalysisSummary.description: Indicates whether to output a Code Analysis summary to the console after analysis. The default is false.

CodeAnalysisTimeout.description: The time, in seconds, that Code Analysis should wait for analysis of a single item to complete before it aborts analysis. Specify 0 to cause Code Analysis to wait indefinitely. The default is 120.

CodeAnalysisTreatWarningsAsErrors.description: Indicates whether to treat all Code Analysis warnings as errors. The default is false.

CodeAnalysisUpdateProject.description: Indicates whether to update the Code Analysis project (*.fxcop) specified in $(CodeAnalysisProject). This applies when there are changes during analysis. The default is false.

CodeAnalysisUseTypeNameInSuppression.description: Indicates whether to include the name of the rule when Code Analysis emits a suppression. The default is true.

CodeAnalysisVerbose.description: Indicates whether to output verbose Code Analysis diagnostic info to the console. The default is false.

Company.description: Company name for the assembly manifest

Configuration.description: The project build configuration (e.g. Debug, Release).

Copyright.description: Copyright details for the NuGet package

DefineConstants.description: Compile-time constants to be defined (e.g. DEBUG, TRACE).

Description.description: A long description of the NuGet package for UI display

DisableFastUpToDateCheck.description: Whether Visual Studio should do its own faster up-to-date check before Building, rather than invoke MSBuild to do a possibly more accurate one. You would set this to false if you have a heavily customized build process and builds in Visual Studio are not occurring when they should.

DocumentationFile.description: The XML documentation file to generate from doc-comments.

EnableSigningChecks.description: Flag indicating whether to enable signing checks during app package generation.

FileVersion.description: Numeric value of the version for the assembly manifest in the format major.minor.build.revision (e.g. 2.4.0.1)

FinalAppxManifestName.description: Path to the final app manifest.

FinalAppxPackageRecipe.description: Full path to the final app package recipe.

FrameworkPathOverride.description: Sets the /sdkpath switch for a VB project to the specified value

GenerateAppxPackageOnBuild.description: Flag indicating whether to generate app package during the build.

GeneratePackageOnBuild.description: Value indicating whether a NuGet package will be generated when the project is built

GenerateDocumentationFile.description: Enable or disable XML comment file generation.

IncludeBuiltProjectOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include primary build outputs into the app package payload.

IncludeComFilesOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include COM files into the app package payload.

IncludeContentFilesProjectOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include content files into the app package payload.

IncludeCopyLocalFilesOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include files marked as 'Copy local' into the app package payload.

IncludeCopyWinmdArtifactsOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include WinMD artifacts into the app package payload.

IncludeCustomOutputGroupForPackaging.description: Flag indicating whether to include custom output group into the app package payload.

IncludeDebugSymbolsProjectOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include debug symbols into the app package payload.

IncludeDocumentationProjectOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include documentation into the app package payload.

IncludeGetResolvedSDKReferences.description: Flag indicating whether to include resolved SDK references into the app package payload.

IncludePriFilesOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include resource index (PRI) files into the app package payload.

IncludeSatelliteDllsProjectOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include satellite DLLs into the app package payload.

IncludeSDKRedistOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include SDK redist into the app package payload.

IncludeSGenFilesOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include SGen files into the app package payload.

IncludeSourceFilesProjectOutputGroup.description: Flag indicating whether to include source files into the app package payload.

InformationalVersion.description: Product version of the assembly for UI display (e.g. 1.0 Beta)

InsertReverseMap.description: Flag indicating whether to insert reverse resource map during resource index generation.

IsPackable.description: Enable or disable production of the project's NuGet package.

LangVersion.description: Which version of the target language (e.g. C# / VB) to use.

LayoutDir.description: Full path to a folder with package layout.

ManagedWinmdInprocImplementation.description: Name of the binary containing managed WinMD in-proc implementation.

MSBuildTreatWarningsAsErrors.description: Indicates whether to treat all warnings as errors when building a project.

MSBuildWarningsAsErrors.description: Indicates a semicolon delimited list of warnings to treat as errors when building a project.

MSBuildWarningsAsMessages.description: Indicates a semicolon delimited list of warnings to treat as low importance messages when building a project.

NeutralLanguage.description: The locale ID for the NuGet package

NoStdLib.description: Whether standard libraries (such as mscorlib) should be referenced automatically (boolean)

NoWarn.description: Comma separated list of disabled warnings

OptionExplicit.description: Should Option Explicit be set (On or Off)

OptionInfer.description: Should Option Infer be set (On or Off)

OptionStrict.description: Should Option Strict be set (On or Off)

OutDir.description: Path to output folder, with trailing slash (legacy property; prefer use of "OutputPath" instead)

OutputPath.description: Path to output folder, with trailing slash

OutputType.description: Type of output to generate (WinExe, Exe, or Library)

PackageIconUrl.description: The URL for a 64x64 image with transparent background to use as the icon for the NuGet package in UI display

PackageId.description: The case-insensitive NuGet package identifier, which must be unique across nuget.org or whatever gallery the NuGet package will reside in. IDs may not contain spaces or characters that are not valid for a URL, and generally follow .NET namespace rules.

PackageLicenseUrl.description: The URL for the NuGet package's license, often shown in UI displays as well as nuget.org

PackageProjectUrl.description: The URL for the NuGet package's home page, often shown in UI displays as well as nuget.org

PackageReleaseNotes.description: A description of the changes made in this release of the NuGet package, often used in UI like the Updates tab of the Visual Studio Package Manager in place of the package description

PackageRequireLicenseAcceptance.description: Value indicating whether the client must prompt the consumer to accept the NuGet package license before installing the package

PackageTags.description: A space-delimited list of tags and keywords that describe the NuGet package and aid discoverability of NuGet packages through search and filtering mechanisms

PackageTargetFallback.description: Allows packages using alternative monikers to be referenced in this project, which include older (e.g. dnxcore50, dotnet5.x) and Portable Class Library names.

PackageVersion.description: Numeric value of the NuGet package version in the format major.minor.patch pattern (e.g. 1.0.1). Version numbers may include a pre-release suffix (e.g. 1.0.1-beta)

PackagingDirectoryWritesLogPath.description: Full path to a text file containing packaging directory writes log.

PackagingFileWritesLogPath.description: Full path to a text file containing packaging file writes log.

PlatformSpecificBundleArtifactsListDir.description: Full path to a folder where platform-specific bundle artifact list files are stored.

PlatformSpecificBundleArtifactsListDirNa.description: Name of the folder where platform-specific bundle artifact lists are stored.

PostBuildEvent.description: Command line to be run at the end of build

PreBuildEvent.description: Command line to be run at the start of build

PreserveCompilationContext.description: Value indicating whether reference assemblies can be used in dynamic compilation

Product.description: Product name information for the assembly manifest

ProjectPriFileName.description: File name to use for project-specific resource index file (PRI).

ProjectPriFullPath.description: Full path to project-specific resource index file (PRI).

ProjectPriIndexName.description: Name of the resource index used in the generated .pri file.

ReferencePath.description: Semicolon separated list of folders to search during reference resolution

RegisterForComInterop.description: Register the assembly's types for COM Interop (boolean).

RepositoryType.description: The type of the repository where the project is stored (e.g. git)

RepositoryUrl.description: The URL for the repository where the project is stored

ResgenToolPath.description: Full path to a folder containing resgen tool.

RootNamespace.description: The default namespace for new code files added to the project.

RunCodeAnalysis.description: Indicates whether to run Code Analysis during the build.

RuntimeIdentifier.description: Runtime identifier supported by the project (e.g. win10-x64)

RuntimeIdentifiers.description: Semicolon separated list of runtime identifiers supported by the project (e.g. win10-x64;osx.10.11-x64;ubuntu.16.04-x64)

SignAssembly.description: Sign the output assembly, giving it a strong name (boolean).

SolutionName.description: The solution file name, without extension.

SolutionPath.description: The full path to the solution file.

StartupObject.description: Type that contains the main entry point

StoreManifestName.description: Name of the store manifest file.

TargetFramework.description: Framework that this project targets. Must be a Target Framework Moniker (e.g. netcoreapp1.0)

TargetFrameworks.description: Semicolon separated list of frameworks that this project targets. Must be a Target Framework Moniker (e.g. netcoreapp1.0;net461)

TargetPlatformSdkRootOverride.description: Full path to platform SDK root.

Title.description: A human-friendly title of the package, typically used in UI displays as on nuget.org and the Package Manager in Visual Studio. If not specified, the package ID is used instead.

UseIncrementalAppxRegistration.description: Flag indicating whether to enable incremental registration of the app layout.

Version.description: Numeric value of the version in the format major.minor.patch (e.g. 2.4.0)

VersionPrefix.description: When Version is not specified, VersionPrefix represents the first fragment of the version string (e.g. 1.0.0). The syntax is VersionPrefix-VersionSuffix].

VersionSuffix.description: When Version is not specified, VersionSuffix represents the second fragment of the version string (e.g. beta). The syntax is VersionPrefix-VersionSuffix].

WarningsAsErrors.description: Comma separated list of warning numbers to treat as errors
